description.narrative: By 2018, 80% of deliveries take place in a health facility in at least 5 provinces.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Country Programme Document 2010-2014 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Burundi: Evaluation finale du projet de lutte contre la malnutrition dans la province de Ngozi au Burundi (mai 2013- décembre 2016)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, 80% of deliveries take place in a health facility in at least 5 provinces.

description.narrative: By the end of 2018, eight pregnant women out of ten gave birth with a skilled health provider. UNICEF equipped three centres for pre-service training on maternal and newborn care and strengthened the prevention of mother-to-child transmission programme contributing to a reduced transmission rate. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Designated BEmONC facilities that are operational on a 24/7 basis
Percentage of health centres having at least 2 service providers trained on neonatal care in target provinces
Health facilities that provide paediatric ART
Proportion of HIV positive mothers receiving ARVs therapy or prophylaxis for PMTCT
